Summary: Hurricane Zeta was a category 2 hurricane that made landfall at Cocodrie, Louisiana
Hurricane Delta was a category 2 hurricane that made landfall near Creole, Louisiana
Hurricane Sally was a category 2 hurricane at landfall in Gulf Shores, Alabama.
Hurricane Laura was a powerful category 4 that made landfall at Cameron Parish, in southwestern Louisiana on August 27.
Hurricane Isaias made landfall in southeastern North Carolina as a category 1 storm.
Torrential rainfall from thunderstorms across coastal Texas and Louisiana caused widespread flooding
California was impacted by an atmospheric river in late-January, in which more than 7 inches of rain fell
Additional major flooding impacted many Southern Plains states significantly affecting agriculture
Historic flooding impacts the Arkansas River Basin with damage to homes, agriculture
A series of hail storms impacted central Texas causing damage to many homes
Historic cold wave and winter storm impacts many northwest, central and eastern states.
Tropical Storm Eta made landfall in the Florida Keys on November 8 followed by a second landfall near Cedar Key
South Texas hail storms cause widespread impact to several cities with golf-ball sized hail damaging many homes
At least 41 tornadoes impact several states including Kentucky, Tennessee, Mississippi, Alabama and Georgia.
Outbreak of at least 140 tornadoes from Texas to Maryland including 3 EF4s, 12 EF3s, 20 EF2s, 77 EF1s
Powerful EF-3 and EF-4 tornadoes cause considerable damage across the Nashville metroplex
More than 80 tornadoes and severe storms caused damage across many southeastern states
Numerous tornadoes caused widespread damage across northern Dallas damaging thousands of homes
